notes.title: Corporate Governance Overview
notes.content: Corporate governance refers to the system of rules, practices, and processes by which a company is directed and controlled. It involves balancing the interests of stakeholders including shareholders, management, customers, suppliers, financiers, government, and the community.

notes.title: Key Principles
notes.content:
The four key principles of corporate governance are:
1. Transparency - Open and honest communication
2. Accountability - Clear responsibility for decisions
3. Fairness - Equal treatment of all stakeholders
4. Responsibility - Acting in the best interests of the company

notes.title: Board of Directors Role
notes.content:
The Board of Directors is responsible for:
• Setting strategic direction
• Overseeing management performance
• Ensuring compliance with laws and regulations
• Protecting shareholder interests
• Managing risks effectively
